, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n|<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">deva\u1e43 nara\u1e25 savit\u0101ra\u1e43\nvipr\u0101 yaj\u00f1ai\u1e25 suv\u1e5bktibhi\u1e25 |<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men, singers worship\nSavitr&nbsp; with hymn and holy rites<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The prefix : O\u1e43 bh\u016br\nbhuva\u1e25 sva\u1e25 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0950</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u0942\u0930\u094d\u092d\u0941\u0935\u0938\u094d\u0935\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">,\n&nbsp;is a formula taken from the Yajurveda</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om \u2013 King Mantra ( of\nSri Yantra geometry )</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bh\u016b &nbsp;&nbsp;\"earth\"prithvi</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bhuvas&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;\"atmosphere\"antariksha</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">svar &nbsp;&nbsp;\"light\" beyond antariksha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gayatri Mantra is also\nknown as the Savitri Mantra.&nbsp;<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Savitri is the mother\nof Prana (Life Force).&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">OR </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">the\ngrace of the divine responsible for creation of the universe</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Savitr in Vedas means Ultimate\nCreative Source&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">OR the stimulator,\nrouser, vivifying power</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gayatri mantra is\nfound in all four Vedas. &nbsp;&nbsp;The goddess &nbsp;invoked in this mantra is Savitr, so the\nmantra is also called S\u0101vitr\u012b. &nbsp;A\npersonification of this mantra has come to be worshiped as a goddess in her own\nright, Gayatri. The Gayatri Mantra is praised in several other Hindu\nscriptures, including Manusm\u1e5bti, Atharvaveda, and the Bhagavad Gita.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gayatri Mantra was\na mandatorypart &nbsp;of the upanayanam\n(sacred thread) ceremony for Brahmins, and was traditionally chanted only by\nBrahmin males, generally as part of their daily rituals. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In modern times, chanting of the Gayatri\nMantra is more widespread, such as at cultural celebrations, and its use has\nspread to include non-Brahmins and women.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/04/upanayanam-sacred-thread-ceremony-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/04/upanayanam-sacred-thread-ceremony-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gayatri is the oldest\nhymn that has maintained continuity to the present day. It is chanted regularly\nby countless followers of the vedic tradition as a part of their daily ritual\nand by many others during yoga meditation. The mantra is considered very\npowerful due to sublimity of its content and cosmic vibrations of its sound.\nThis mantra has inspired generations of Vedic poets and seers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Savitr represents that\ngreat ParaBrahman<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tuv\u00e9 v\u00ed\u015bv\u0101 sarasvati\n\u015brit\u0101\u0301 \u0101\u0301 y\u016b\u1e41\u1e63i deviy\u0101\u0301m |<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u015bun\u00e1hotre\u1e63u matsuva\npraj\u0101\u0301\u1e41 devi didi\u1e0d\u1e0dhi na\u1e25 |17|<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In you the divine, O\nSarasvati, all forms (or, energies) of life are set. Take delight in the Shunahotras\n(in us, who have joy in the sacrifice); O Goddess bestow progeny (inner offspring)\non us. &nbsp;( RV &nbsp;2-41-17 )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">im\u0101\u0301 &nbsp;br\u00e1hma sarasvati ju\u1e63\u00e1sva v\u0101jin\u012bvati |<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">y\u0101\u0301 &nbsp;te m\u00e1nma gr\u0325tsamad\u0101\u0301 &nbsp;r\u0325t\u0101vari priy\u0101\u0301 &nbsp;dev\u00e9\u1e63u j\u00fahvati |18|<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">O Sarasvati, you, who\nare full of substantial energy, welcome these words (upwelling) from the soul,\nwhich, O Truthful one, we Gritsamadas (who delight in a clear mind) offer as expressive\nthoughts to you, dear among the Gods. ( RV &nbsp;2-41-18 )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red;\">HE WHITE INVADER RIDICULED SAVITR ( SARASWATI ) AS THE DAUGHTER OF BRAHMA -- &nbsp;WHOM HE COMMITTED INCEST WITH</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">ROGUE GURU SRI SRI RAVISHANKAR TOLD ON TV THAT SHIVA &nbsp;( HUMPING ) HAD GAY ANAL SEX WITH VISHNU ( RECEIVING ) AND PRODUCED LORD AYYAPPA ( VISHNUs 9TH AVATAR )&nbsp;</span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 32px; white-space: pre-wrap; word-wrap: break-word;\">\nHomosexuality has never been considered a crime in Hindu culture. In fact, Lord Ayyappa was born of Hari-Hara (Vishnu &amp; Shiva). </div>\n</div>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THE WHITE INVADER WROTE\nTHAT SHIVA WAS A CORPSE EATER HANGING AROUND CREMATION GROUNDS,&nbsp; AND A TRIBAL SEX MANIAC WHO FUCKED THE WIVES\nOF THE SAPT RISHIS BEHIND THEIR BACKS WHEN THEY WERE MEDITATING <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">SAPT RISHIS ARE SEVEN\nSTARS OF THE GREAT DIPPER.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/aghoris-corpse-eaters-of-india-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/aghoris-corpse-eaters-of-india-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">THE WHITE INVADER WROTE\nTHAT OUR HINDU &nbsp;TEMPLES WERE FULL OF WHORES &nbsp;WHO\nPRETENDED TO BE DANCERS</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">THE WHITE INVADER WROTE\nTHAT TEMPLES WERE USED TO SACRIFICE ANIMALS AND MAHARISHIS ATE BEEF</span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>A DHARMIC LIFE MANUAL\nCALLED KAMASUTRA WAS CONVERTED TO A PERVERTED SEX MANUAL</b></span></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/07/kamasutra-by-vatsayana-immoral-sexual.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/07/kamasutra-by-vatsayana-immoral-sexual.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-_sXq1v5SbKc/WWSSkF1w54I/AAAAAAABUuc/O4EfnVxL2nc-7JRVOXt0f5qNGAPBOXC1ACLcBGAs/s1600/mqde885fault.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"180\" data-original-width=\"320\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-_sXq1v5SbKc/WWSSkF1w54I/AAAAAAABUuc/O4EfnVxL2nc-7JRVOXt0f5qNGAPBOXC1ACLcBGAs/s640/mqde885fault.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">TIME HAS NOW COME TO BUST THE GREATEST LIE OF\nTHE&nbsp; BASTARD&nbsp; IMMORAL WHITE INVADER AND HIS FAKE MUTTS&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fZ9S-x4tST4/WWSSAtFThMI/AAAAAAABUuY/AjXbmK1KIy4vR-ISivXojd1nPEFP8bx8wCLcBGAs/s1600/m8811M.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"563\" data-original-width=\"1000\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fZ9S-x4tST4/WWSSAtFThMI/AAAAAAABUuY/AjXbmK1KIy4vR-ISivXojd1nPEFP8bx8wCLcBGAs/s640/m8811M.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The four purusharthas or goals of human life\nare 1. &nbsp;Dharma (righteousness, duty and moral order) &nbsp;2. Artha (wealth and\nprosperity) 3. </span><span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Kama (desirable action ) &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">4. Moksha (liberation)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">KAMA PURUSHARTHA</span></b> IS NOT LUST BUT DESIRABLE\nACTION.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">KAMA </span><span style=\"color: red;\">HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH LUST OR SEX AS IS\nWRITTEN BY THE WHITE INVADER</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Purushartha means those actions which are\nproper and correct<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2CzFH5hOM_w/WWSRbNFbOlI/AAAAAAABUuU/DSb_fHkRj4I0wJmayPQNtwlM5xf7Q0o0wCLcBGAs/s1600/hqdefmmault.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"360\" data-original-width=\"480\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2CzFH5hOM_w/WWSRbNFbOlI/AAAAAAABUuU/DSb_fHkRj4I0wJmayPQNtwlM5xf7Q0o0wCLcBGAs/s640/hqdefmmault.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Kama</span><span style=\"color: red;\"> is a broad subject which encompasses\narts, emotions, poetry . relationships and other sciences<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-W3ojqArpYh8/WWSUJE_oJ6I/AAAAAAABUuo/UgyP6G5q4Zw1WtBdc_rEa3FHXwaUKsutwCLcBGAs/s1600/im66ages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"168\" data-original-width=\"300\" height=\"224\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-W3ojqArpYh8/WWSUJE_oJ6I/AAAAAAABUuo/UgyP6G5q4Zw1WtBdc_rEa3FHXwaUKsutwCLcBGAs/s400/im66ages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The aim of life of an individual is determined\nby the doctrine of Purushartha. &nbsp; It also decides the course of life of man and\nlays down norms and values for the behaviour patterns.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qS4QIMaK4Vg/WWSS-hmwoeI/AAAAAAABUug/k-GV5DzWhPwRP0TMjBmhte19WSF6nuwiACLcBGAs/s1600/imabhges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"268\" data-original-width=\"188\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qS4QIMaK4Vg/WWSS-hmwoeI/AAAAAAABUug/k-GV5DzWhPwRP0TMjBmhte19WSF6nuwiACLcBGAs/s400/imabhges.jpg\" width=\"280\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Purushartha means \u201cPurusharthate\nPurushartha\u201d, which are the efforts made by the individual to achieve the aims,\ngoals and ultimate values of life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The ultimate end of Hindu culture is to\nattain \u2018Moksha\u2019 or salvation and hence, man should behave in such a manner that\nthis aim may be achieved- and this does NOT mean wanton , debauched sex..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">By Purushartha we mean the pursuance of those\nactions which lead to the fulfillment of socially approved values and goal.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-GV16sIlCfZs/WWSQ7k57tAI/AAAAAAABUuQ/jrrSKTCDKWcfOGBzK-5XWFI4DrMxdnyogCLcBGAs/s1600/23-1435jjj047721-kama-sutra.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"450\" data-original-width=\"600\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-GV16sIlCfZs/WWSQ7k57tAI/AAAAAAABUuQ/jrrSKTCDKWcfOGBzK-5XWFI4DrMxdnyogCLcBGAs/s640/23-1435jjj047721-kama-sutra.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Kama</span><span style=\"color: red;\"> refers to all the desires in man for the\nenjoyment and satisfaction and sensual gratification of the five human senses.</span></b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GT22tOcf5FY/WWSTgYrh14I/AAAAAAABUuk/61WnifrUmKQslqeX4FwxpYyFmmCgVfmswCLcBGAs/s1600/51tGiqIgG4894L._SY346_.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"346\" data-original-width=\"218\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GT22tOcf5FY/WWSTgYrh14I/AAAAAAABUuk/61WnifrUmKQslqeX4FwxpYyFmmCgVfmswCLcBGAs/s640/51tGiqIgG4894L._SY346_.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">KAMA&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"color: blue;\">could be music or being creative or team spirit in sport or travelling\nto places of natural beauty or sitting with family at the beach or riding a\nfast horse or participating in a arrow shooting contest&nbsp; - anything which brings delight to human life\nand spirit .</span></b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-R-QdhK_8Gwo/WWSQqiky0oI/AAAAAAABUuM/mWyOetOtOFMlcoF2wc2GsU0c1CT_BMxrgCLcBGAs/s1600/1822.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"500\" data-original-width=\"600\" height=\"532\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-R-QdhK_8Gwo/WWSQqiky0oI/AAAAAAABUuM/mWyOetOtOFMlcoF2wc2GsU0c1CT_BMxrgCLcBGAs/s640/1822.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Kama </span>has absolutely nothing to do with LUST and\nsexual orgasm.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Kama</span> would refer to the\ntotality of the innate desires and drives of man-&nbsp; motivations of man. <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Kama</span> refers to the instinctive and emotional\nlife of man, and provides for the satisfaction of his aesthetic urges.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sanatana Dharma wants man and woman to be\nhappy as this is the chief purpose of life and of course the final goal of\nMoksha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; Wat could be for Lakshmi(Vishnu wife)?</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_5BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_5b+seedBBTnD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_1T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_1TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_5b+seedBBTnD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_2B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3437493621882758577\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_2M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499699605516#c3437493621882758577\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 10, 2017 at 8:43 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_2MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nLAXMI IS THE WIFE OF VISHNU --SHE IS A COSMIC ALLEGORY KNOWN AS LOKAMATA ( MOTHER OF THE WORLD )<br />\n<br />\nMEANING OF LAXMI IS \"PERCEIVE \" -- SHE HAS THE PERCEPTION TO ALLOW MOKSHA SOULS TO VAIKUNTA --THE SEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\n<br />\nMOKSHA SOULS MERGE WITH THE FIELD OF BRAHMAN<br />\n<br />\nBRAHMAN THE MOTHER FIELD HAS SHEARED OFF SMALL ENERGY BALLS LOWERED ITS FREQUENCY AND SEND THEM TO EARTH --TO EVOLVE FROM FUNGUS -- BACTERIA - TO ANIMAL - TO MAN TO MOKSHA SOUL OF HIGHEST FREQUENCY SAME AS THE MOTHER FIELD --AND MERGE BACK WITH LIFEs EXPERIENCES<br />\n<br />\nA CLOSED LOOP INFORMATION GATHERING<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nOur Vedas and Puranas describe Laxmi--<br />\nLakshmi is exceptionally beautiful, standing on a lotus with four hands, two of which hold lotus flowers, and the lower right offering blessings of fortune, and the lower left held in the upright mudra or posture of benediction or blessings. The lotus she carries in her hands represents that the realization of the Self is the supreme goal of life. They also indicate the various worlds and living beings in different states of development or evolution. Sometimes she may be holding a potted coconut in one hand, which is another representation of Lakshmi. However, when she is in the company of Lord Vishnu, she can be seen with two or four hands. Her four hands indicate the four main blessings of human existence, namely dharma (acts of righteousness and duty), artha (wealth), kama (sensual pleasures), and moksha (final liberation).<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nLakshmi is depicted as the goddess of fortune, power and beauty in the Vedas<br />\n<br />\nWHEN WE MAKE AN INTENION AND BURTS A COCONUT--WE INVOKE THE GODDESS OF GOOD FORTUNE LAXMI<br />\n<br />\nIn the Bhagavata, the text speaks of Vaikuntha, adorable to all the worlds (X.12.26), as the highest realm where Visnu resides (XII.24.14). This, too, is the highest region (IV.12.26); beyond the world of darkness and samara (the cycle of birth and death) (IV.24.29; X.88.25); the destination of those who have transcended the three gunas even while they are still alive (XI.25.22); and beyond which there is no higher place (II.2.18, II.9.9). The peaceful ascetics who reach that place never return (IV.9.29; X.88.25-6). The residents of Vaikuntha do not have material bodies, but have pure forms (VII.1.34). These forms are like that of Visnu (III.15.14ff.), also known as Narayana<br />\n<br />\nVaikuntha is an abode exclusive to Lord Hari, his consort the goddess Sri Lakshmi and other liberated souls that have gained moksha. The Vaiku\u1e47\u1e6dha planets begin 26,200,000 yojanas (209,600,000 miles) above Satyaloka.<br />\n<br />\nOwing to her association with the Lotus flower she is also called Padm\u0101 or Kamal\u0101.<br />\n<br />\nLaxmi followed Vamana to Patala as Vamana out of remorse ( banishing King Mahabali of Kerala ) was staying back . Padma tied a rakhi torn from her sree on Mahabali's hand , made him her brother and asked that he coax Vamana back to her<br />\n<br />\nAs per our Puranas Laxmi emerges during the creation of universe, floating over the water on the expanded petals of a lotus flower.<br />\n<br />\nLaxmi appeared with a lotus in her hand and so she is also called Padma. Laxmi embodies the spiritual world, also known as Vaikunta. She is the embodiment of the mediator/ preserver energy of Vishnu and primordial Prakriti who creates the universe. Goddess Kishijoten of Japan corresponds to Lakshmi<br />\n<br />\nBRAHMA AND SHIVA ARE OPPOSITE FORCES . VISHNU MEDIATES --AND LIFE GOES ON<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_2BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_2B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_3B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7032706577704971384\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_3M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499699757470#c7032706577704971384\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 10, 2017 at 8:45 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_3MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nInherent in the BrahmAn ( the morphogenetic consciousness field ) is the TRINITY of Hindu Gods BRAHMA/ VISHNU/ SHIVA as CREATOR / MEDIATOR/ DESTROYER \u2013 each a sub force field ..also known as TAMAS / SATTVA / RAJAS .<br />\n<br />\nTamas and Rajas are opposing fields like positive and negative while Sattva is neutral. This is represented by the Trident ( trishul ) of Lord Shiva, where the centre prong SATTVA is the midpoint of duality, between TAMAS and RAJAS .<br />\n<br />\nIn Dvaita Hinduism opposite poles Tamas and Rajas are conscious of each other. Tamas creates Rajas, and Rajas activates/ excites Tamas.<br />\n<br />\n7000 year old Vedas say that the only constant in the cosmos is change, everything is in a state of flux, nothing is static-- everything is vibratory. This is what guarantees growth and evolution.<br />\n<br />\nThis is NOT like Darwin\u2019s mindless evolution from man to monkey.<br />\n<br />\nThis dance of opposite forces concept was lifted and termed as Yin Yang , by the Chinese after this concept was introduced there by Bodhi Dharma .<br />\n<br />\nIt is a cosmic spiraling dance of separate opposing forces, which sustains this universe. No life is possible on earth without this subtle tension . What has a front has a back-- what has a beginning has an end.<br />\n<br />\nBrahma / Vishnu / Shiva work in tandem and perfect harmony\u2014amazing cosmic allegories personalized as Hindu Gods.<br />\n<br />\nOne cannot exist without the other and they are dependant . No phenomenon in this universe is completely devoid of its opposite. They consume each other yet support each other.<br />\n<br />\nWhatever is in excess gets reduces, whatever is deficient gets replenished.<br />\n<br />\nYou must ponder over each waxing-waning cycle to appreciate the absolute truth . They keep each other in check, yet provide fuel to feed off each other.<br />\n<br />\nThe white invader cooked up cock and bull stories, how the three trinity gods held competitions to see who is stronger ? This white lie is now sunk forever \u2013 never to resurface . Let the Shaivites and Vaishnavites wedges apart by the FAKE mutts of the white invader ( divide and rule ) know this truth today.<br />\n<br />\nThey have their female consort wives Saraswati/ Laxmi/ Parvati without which they are powerless<br />\n<br />\nYang elements are clear and obvious while Yin elements are subtle or hidden behind the quantum screen..<br />\n<br />\nIt is a perfect tango of dynamic balance where one polar opposite changes into another smoothly and constantly .<br />\n<br />\nIf the restraining balance or equilibrium is lost by the mediator ( Vishnu ) , the universe will spiral out of control and end. This is why Lord Vishnu is called the PRESERVER god.<br />\n<br />\nAs for the opposing forces TAMAS/ RAJAS ( Brahma/ Shiva ) it really does NOT matter as who is who, like in AC electricity-where you can plug into the socket both ways.<br />\n<br />\nThis principle of Dvaita Hinduism -- Tamas Rajas , which are rooted together , is present in every phenomenon on earth. Vedanta has recorded 7000 years ago, that energy transforms from one to another\u2014it can neither be created or destroyed.<br />\n<br />\nThese two opposing forces are natural and transform each other , in perfect harmony. Harmony can never be stagnant . Lessening of Tamas always results in increase of Rajas and vice versa.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_3MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_3BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_3B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_4B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6237777133122229465\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_4M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499699792666#c6237777133122229465\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 10, 2017 at 8:46 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_4MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nBalance can never be permanent\u2014 Tamas and Rajas continiously devour each other \u2013 and life flows on.<br />\n<br />\nFew examples of this eternal cycle of inter dependant reversal and immediate exchange are:--<br />\n<br />\nParticle/ anti particle<br />\nWave/ photon<br />\nBlack hole/ quasar<br />\nDay/night<br />\nConscious/ subconscious<br />\nWinter/ summer<br />\nAerobic bacteria/ anaerobic<br />\nMan/ woman<br />\nCatabolism/ anabolism<br />\nPressure/ Vacuum<br />\nPotential energy/ kinetic energy<br />\nEvaporation/ condensation<br />\nCreation/ destruction<br />\nOxidation/ antioxidation<br />\nAttraction/ repulsion<br />\nGather / disperse<br />\nExcitation/ inhibition<br />\nAbsorbsion/ secretion<br />\nContraction/ relaxation<br />\nCoagulation/ anticoagulation<br />\nAcid/ base<br />\nElectron balance/ counterbalance<br />\nPositive pole/ negative<br />\nMagnetic North/ south<br />\nCounterclockwise vortex/ clockwise<br />\nSleep/ wake<br />\nFreezing/ melting<br />\nVaporisation/ condensation<br />\nIonisation/ deionisation<br />\nEnergy/ matter<br />\nProton/ electron<br />\nBirth/ decay<br />\nCathode/ anode<br />\nStatic/ Dynamic<br />\nClosed/ Open<br />\nOrganic / Inorganic<br />\nGravity / Antigravity<br />\nDeliberate/ Spontaneous<br />\nDevas/ Asuras<br />\nPull / Push<br />\n<br />\nTamas influences Rajas not only from inside but also from outside.. they are rooted together. Tamas and Rajas are connected through consciousness. It is about the quantum possibility wave vibration between two poles.<br />\n<br />\nAncient Vedic Indian rishis in 9000 BC on the banks of the river Saraswati, firmly believed that the invisible below the quantum screen gives rise to the visible. So either Tamas or Rajas is visible \u2013 never both.<br />\n<br />\nTogether the TRINITY - THE SECOND TEMPLATE express the supreme BRAHMAN - THE BASE TEMPLATE at absolute peace with itself.<br />\n<br />\nThis universe cannot exist without vibrations between two poles.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n</div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_5b+seedBBTnD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6462833591834537796\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_74M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/12333354635999003839\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Sangeetha</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499722689123#c6462833591834537796\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 11, 2017 at 3:08 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_74MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nDear Captain, thank you for revealing the connection between gayatri mantra and saraswati. Water can store information about substances that were once in it but that have physically disappeared--the reason why we immerse cremated ashes in the river<br />\n<br />\nOur brain stores information in the holographic form. Every cell in our body carries all information to produce a copy.<br />\n<br />\nWater absorbs radiation of all wavelengths from the cosmos. Human vibrational energy, thoughts, words, ideas and music, affect the molecular structure of water.<br />\n<br />\nWater registers precise molecular information about the world around it, and that is extremely sensitive to these frequencies coming into it.Water remembers, or stores this information, and that it can transport this into new environments when it travels through various water cycles.<br />\n<br />\nSubconscious mind never sleeps even in a coma Every experience we have ever had is impressed somewhere in the electrochemical cells in our brain. The brain records everything\u2014everything thrown up by our 5 senses\u2014 and it is imprinted in the brain cells for ever.<br />\n<br />\nWhenever something reactivates those cells we get a mental picture duplicating the original experience. Subconscious mind has a memory of more than 100 trillion images, all our experiences, emotions and feelings are stored as an image or a sound in a digitised or rather a holographic manner .<br />\n<br />\nData that cannot be recalled are retained in the subconscious. A person may be unconscious of ever having been locked in a closet as a child, yet under hypnosis he may recall the experience vividly. Negative suggestions with growing children gets rooted in their subconscious mind and is reflected later in their behavior.<br />\n<br />\nMany of the assertions of neuroscience are deductions made from scientific medical experiments on animals who are NOT conscious.<br />\n<br />\nOnly rank stupid people do this.<br />\n<br />\nOnly conscious creatures can see themselves in a mirror like man, elephant, dolphins and certain apes . Try showing your cat or dog a mirror.<br />\n<br />\nWhen we learn at school and college and finally forget everything, you are educated. It is NOT about remembering . It is about making neural pathways in the brain \u2013 or for a layman digging new tunnels .<br />\n<br />\nThis is where our Indian education system is found wanting. Education system in school should be all about digging new tunnels or connecting more circuits in the brain.<br />\n<br />\nIt is NOT about knowing that the capital of India is New Delhi and getting 100% marks for that.<br />\n<br />\nMyelin growth leads to faster transmission of the electrical signals down the axon, and better timing of neuronal signals. Neurons that fire together wire together. When neurons fire at the same time, the connections between the neurons get stronger.<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">GAYATRI MANTRA GIVES MYELIN RESILIENCE --DUE TO THE POWER OF THE VIBRATIONS</span></b><br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_74b+seedpjJD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_74b+seedpjJD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"http://img1.blogblog.com/img/b36-rounded.png\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6906644608656144887\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_229M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/06471797010022507536\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Anand Niranjan</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499878037241#c6906644608656144887\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 10:17 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_229MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nNamaste Captain ji,<br />\n<br />\nI have been reading your series on Sanatana Dharma and any praise I can give will only be like holding a candle to the Sun. RAMAYANA THERE IS ONLY ONE GOD<br />\n<br />\nVISHNU AVATAR RAMA<br />\n<br />\nHANUMAN IS A SIDE CHARACTER<br />\n<br />\nJEW ROTHSCHILD CAUSED HANUMAN CHALISA TO BE WRITTEN USING A DASA WHO NEVER VERSES-- DASAS NEVER EXISTED<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/unknown-history-of-sikhs-and-sikhism.html</span><br />\n<br />\nSANATANA DHARMA HAS NO PLACE FOR BHAKTI -- THE GREAT WAY OF LIFE ALLOWED ONLY SHRADDHA<br />\n<br />\n\u201cSHRADDHA\u201d WAS REPLACED BY \u201cBHAKTI\u201d \u2013 BY JEW ROTHSCHILD<br />\n<br />\nThe BHAKTI movement during Islam rule never happened.<br />\n<br />\nAll the BHAKTI MOVEMENT HEROES are FAKE and backdated creations of Jew Rothschild\u2014the most famous being the DASA characters .<br />\n<br />\nJew Rothschild\u2019s historians LIED that Bhakti movement was a revival, reworking and recontextualisation of ancient Vedic traditions<br />\n<br />\nIn Sanatana Dharma the six virtues are Sama, dama, uparati, titiksha, SHRADDHA and samadhana<br />\n<br />\nYour willingness to know the unknown is shraddha<br />\n<br />\nRecognition of the unknown is Shraddha.<br />\n<br />\nShankara describes ShraddhA 4000 years ago--as unwavering faith in the statements of sruti and guru ( a true teacher will only quote from authoritative srutis)<br />\n<br />\nShraddhaavaan labhathe jnanam--- That person alone who has shraddha can secure wisdom<br />\n<br />\nShraddha means unwavering faith in the sacred scriptures or shastras and in the moral codes they contain as well as in the atma ( soul )<br />\n<br />\nThe shastras are designed to ensure the peace and prosperity of the world and the spiritual perfection of mankind..<br />\n<br />\nThis is not blind faith.<br />\n<br />\nIt is based on accurate reasoning, evidence and experience. Then only it can be lasting faith. Then only it can be perfect, unshakeable faith.<br />\n<br />\nSuperstitious beliefs, beliefs in mere religious traditions or social customs cannot help one in spiritual advancement. The mind will be ever restless. Various doubts will crop up every now and then.<br />\n<br />\nSectarians force their beliefs on others, try to convert them and take them in their fold to strengthen their numbers.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is the most important qualification. No spiritual progress is possible without shraddha.<br />\n<br />\nFrom shraddha comes nistha or one-pointed devotion and from nistha comes self-realization. If the faith is flickering, it will die soon and the aspirant will be drifted aimlessly hither and thither.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is faith in your own self first, faith in the method of practice which you are adopting, faith in your Guru who has initiated you, and faith in the existence of God.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_231MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_231BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_231B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</span></li>\n<span id=\"bc_0_229b+seedDmD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_232B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1051593625855643983\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_232M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499879580191#c1051593625855643983\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 10:43 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_232MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nAncient maharishis talked about the quality of \u201cshraddha\u201d which is a positive energy that comes from within.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is a Sanskrit Malayalam word -- an unshakable conviction in our journey<br />\n<br />\nWe need this conviction, or shraddha, to strengthen our intent to achieve success.<br />\n<br />\nYoga goes way beyond the mat.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha should not be translated as a \u201csimple\u201d faith / trust, --it also conveys mental and intellectual firmness<br />\n<br />\nSINGING BHAJANS LIKE ASSHOLES ( BHAKTI MOVEMENT OF JEW ROTHSCHILD ) BEATING DHOLAKS AND SHAKING ASS , HAS NEVER BEEN PART OF HINDUISM.<br />\n<br />\nBHAJANS CREATED IN VERNACULAR BY JEW ROTHSCHILDs FAKE DASASS AND FAKE MUTTS ARE NOT MANTRAS IN SANSKRIT<br />\n<br />\nWe build our \u201cshraddha\u201d by pushing through fear and trusting implicitly in our feelings and conscience .<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is the divine medicine.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha comes from two Sanskrit words: shrat (shrad), which means \u201ctruth\u201d or \u201cfaithfulness,\u201d and dha, which translates \u201cto put or place; to direct one\u2019s mind toward.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nIn the opening verses of the 17th chapter OF Bhagwad Gita , Krishna says that faith results from our most steadfast convictions.<br />\n<br />\nWhen our mind is pure, he says, we find faith in benevolence, having little attachment to what we ourselves can gain.<br />\n<br />\nYoga itself is an act of faith arising from the heart, and by having faith in the fundamental aims of yoga, \u201ca faithful person obtains knowledge.\u201d (Bhagawad Gita 4.39- 4000 BC)<br />\n<br />\nBut a person whose faith is based only on mundane truths, or who is without faith and overwhelmed by doubt, \u201ccomes to nothing.\u201d (BG 4.40)<br />\n<br />\nShraddha sustains us like a loving mother. We are calmed by its presence. We rest and grow in it. It nurtures us. To illustrate this, Shraddha ( faith/ trust ) is frequently personified in India as a feminine image\u2014a loving and protective force that nurtures us like a mother or a goddess.<br />\n<br />\nPatanjali\u2019s concept of faith, is not a religious commitment but a deeply personal expression of inner harmony.<br />\n<br />\nTrust in the words of the teacher and Vedanta is Shraddha. Yoga offers assurance of renewed health, restored self-confidence, or of a spiritual reality beckoning from within. Out of these or similar certitudes, threads are woven together, gradually forming a fabric of shraddha that is distinctively yours.<br />\n<br />\nNo learning in a Gurukul is complete without chewing the cud along in a group with the Guru.<br />\n<br />\nBlind devotion and belief takes a back seat .<br />\n<br />\nEverything is thrashed out in grace , harmony and transparency<br />\n<br />\nShraddha, is surrender to the Pramana so that the Pramana can operate.<br />\n<br />\nPramana literally means \"proof\" and \"means of knowledge\". It refers to epistemology in Indian philosophies, and is one of the key, much debated fields of study in Hinduism<br />\n<br />\nIt would be absurd to call shraddhda in veda as \u2018rigid belief\u2019. ShraddhA cannot be translated into belief at all.<br />\n<br />\nThe Shraddha or trust that we have in Vedanta enables us to maintain a certain frame of mind wherein we don\u2019t question what Vedanta says, but try to understand what it says.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha or trust does not mean that we have to blindly accept whatever the teacher tells us. It only means that we give it the benefit of the doubt and look upon it with a certain reverence.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha, trust / faith, must arise in its own way. It must be discovered. It cannot be commanded. This reverence for scripture cannot be thrust upon anybody.<br />\n<br />\nWe discover it as we get exposed to Vedanta, appreciate its profundity and clarity, and see how it releases us from different notions and complexes.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_232MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_232BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_232B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_233B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2117392502600893195\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_233M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499879625622#c2117392502600893195\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 10:43 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_233MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nJust as we cannot make ourselves love someone, we cannot make ourselves have Shraddha. Love has to manifest itself. Similarly, Shraddha is not something that we can command; it has to happen.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha, trust and reverence, is essential to learn and enjoy an open mind. An open mind is willing to shed its conclusions and prejudices and is ready to learn and change<br />\n<br />\nIn having Shraddha, there is trust, faith, reverence, devotion, openness, and freedom. In fact, this is the trust where there is freedom.<br />\n<br />\nThe word \u201cfaith\u201d scares a Hindu.<br />\n<br />\nA Hindu free of dogma ( like in other single holy book religions ) is skeptical when this question of trust / faith arises because faith is always understood to be blind faith.<br />\n<br />\nBut here we are talking not about blind faith, but enlightened faith, a faith that we discover as a result of self verification.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha or reverential faith enables that learning frame of mind and, therefore, is freedom. Such a mind remains free from doubts and questions and open to the teacher and the teaching.<br />\n<br />\nLord Krishna also gives importance to Shraddha and says in the Bhagavad Gita:--<br />\n<br />\nOne who has Shraddha ( not BHAKTI ) gains knowledge.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is defined as trust or faith in the words of Vedanta pending verification.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is faith in Vedanta as a Pramana, a means of knowledge for knowing the Self, just as eyes are a means of knowledge with respect to colour and form.<br />\n<br />\nVedanta is not to be looked upon as speculation or philosophy.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is trust in the Guru too. Trust in the Guru is required because the key to Vedanta is the teaching tradition.<br />\n<br />\nAgain , shraddha is not blind faith, but enlightened faith based on verification. We discover faith when we implement Vedanta in our lives and verify whether what the teachings say is true.<br />\n<br />\nFaith is the ability to believe what we do not see. The reward of faith is to see what we did not believe.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is more than mere faith. It also implies self\u2013reliance, an independent sense of right and wrong, reliance on conscience and the courage of one\u2019s own conviction<br />\n<br />\nFaith in Sanatana Dharma begins as an experiment and ends as an experience.<br />\n<br />\nFaith expressed in action is a sure means of realization. Faith is not blind. It is the willingness to try free of threats of dogma.<br />\n<br />\nFaith is the belief in the unknown. Faith heals, faith creates, faith works wonders, faith moves mountains. Faith is the searchlight for finding brahman.<br />\n<br />\nHe who has no faith in himself can never have faith in God.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha hrudayya yakutyaa shradhayaa vindate vasu. --(Rig Veda 10/151/4) 5000 BC.<br />\nMeaning: Shraddha (faith) is the symbol of the high sentiment of the heart.<br />\n<br />\nA Hindu is allowed to question and discuss; but the attitude matters. If one questions with the idea of throwing shit on Veda, then it is lack of shraddha (ashraddha).<br />\n<br />\nInstead if one says, veda cannot be wrong, but there is some confusion in my understanding and the concept of me being the whole, the truth, is not sinking; then it is shraddha.<br />\n<br />\nSHRADDA WAS REPLACED BY BHAKTI (BLIND DEVOTION ) AND SANATANA DHARMA WAS HIJACKED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD ..<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 4-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_233MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_233BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_233B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_234B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1588843338669038895\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_234M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499879661932#c1588843338669038895\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 10:44 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_234MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 3-<br />\n<br />\nAT EVERY DESH DROHI LITERARY FEST, A HUGE CHUNK OF TIME IS LEFT ASIDE FOR THE FAKE AND BACKDATED CREATIONS OF ROTHSCHILDs BHAKTI MOVEMENT<br />\n<br />\nAGAMA OF THE FAKE TAMIL MUTTS INTRODUCED LENGTHY, PONDEROUS , MEANINGLESS RITUALS , GIVING MONOPOLY TO STOOGE BRAHMINS \u2013 NONE OF WHICH BELONG TO SANATANA DHARMA<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nYou should have faith (shradda) not only to practice your religion or achieve liberation but also to gain mastery in any endeavor. Faith is propelled by both conviction and dedication.<br />\n<br />\nsattvanurupa sarvasya<br />\nsraddha bhavati bharata<br />\nsraddha-mayo 'yam puruso<br />\nyo yac-chraddhah sa eva sah<br />\n<br />\nsattva-anurupa\u2014according to the existence; sarvasya\u2014of everyone; sraddha\u2014faith; bhavati\u2014becomes; bharata\u2014O son of Bharata; sraddha\u2014faith; mayah\u2014full; ayam\u2014this; purusah\u2014living entity; yah\u2014anyone; yat\u2014that; sraddhah\u2014faith; sah\u2014that; eva\u2014certainly; sah\u2014he.<br />\n<br />\nTRANSLATION<br />\nAccording to one's existence under the various modes of nature, one evolves a particular kind of faith. The living being is said to be of a particular faith according to the modes he has acquired. Bhagawad Gita\u20144000 BC<br />\n<br />\nHindu tradition never demanded that their students should blindly believe or \"swallow\" anything --<br />\n<br />\n\u201c IF YOU DON\u2019T LIKE IT , LUMP IT \u201c TYPE DOGMA.<br />\n<br />\nHINDUS ARE ASKED TO APPLY THEIR CONSCIENCE .<br />\n<br />\nNo guru wants his students to believe; he wanted his students to understand and agree . A teacher wants students to understand, to know, unlike a SINGLE HOLY BOOK DOGMA preacher who wants listeners to believe.<br />\n<br />\nShraddha is the first step in one's search for God. In the fourth chapter of the Bhagavad Gita, Sri Krishna says, \"shraddhavan labhate jnanam, one with shraddha gains knowledge.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS FOUL AND CUNNING SUBSTITUTION OF SHRADDHA WITH BHAKTI, IN THE WARP AND WEFT OF HINDUISM BY JEW ROTHSCHILD REDUCED THE GREAT SPIRITUALITY OF SANATANA DHARMA TO THE ABSURD LEVEL OF SINGLE HOLY BOOK/ SINGLE MESSIAH RELIGIONS ..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS THE GREATEST OF MY MORE THAN TEN THOUSAND REVELATIONS IN THIS BLOGSITE.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_229b+seedDmD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_229b+seedDmD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_229b+seedDmD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3TZEp_n3eIc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/3TZEp_n3eIc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_168M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/10/time-has-come-to-save-watan-time-is-now.html?showComment=1508157200873#c2320084546700134565\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">October 16, 2017 at 6:03 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_78MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSOMEONE ASKED ME\u2014<br />\n<br />\nJUST BECAUSE BRITISH STONENEHENGE HAS 27 PORTALS HOW CAN IT BE A HINDU STRUCTURE ?<br />\n<br />\nLISTEN--- 27 PORTALS IS FOR 27 NAKSHATRAS<br />\n<br />\nEach of the 27 Nakshatra is divided into four Pada = 4 quarters. 27 x 4 = 108= digital value of OM<br />\n<br />\n108 IS A DIVINE NUMBER --<br />\n<br />\nNOBODY CAN STEAL THIS NUMBER AND GIVE IT TO ANY OTHER LAND OTHER THAN INDIA , OR RELIGION OTHER THAN SANATANA DHARMA.<br />\n<br />\nNakshatra ( Asterism ) is the general term, referring to any identified pattern of stars.<br />\n<br />\nThe ecliptic is divided into each of the nakshatras eastwards starting from this first point of Aries<br />\n<br />\nFirst point of Aries is the spot where equinoctial cuts the ecliptic.. The First Point of Aries, is current at PISCES and is a mismomer . It just show the Greeks lifted from Kerala astrology-- It, defines the zero-point for Right Ascension.<br />\n<br />\nBEFORE THE \u201c INTERSECTION OF EQUINOCTIAL AND ECLIPTIC \u201c WAS AT ARIES \u2014 ONLY KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY OWNED BY THE CALICUT KING KNEW ASTRONOMY<br />\n<br />\nRISHABHAM- TAURUS (4300 BC ) / MEDAM- ARIES (2150 BC ) / MENAM- PISCES ( 1 AD ) / KUMBHAM - AQUARIUS (2150 AD )<br />\n<br />\nThe First Point of Aries is not a fixed point in space: it moves along the Ecliptic at a rate of roughly one degree every seventy years. When the Equinox was first observed, thousands of years ago, the First Point actually lay in the constellation of Aries.<br />\n<br />\nWhen the Sun reaches the First Point of Aries, as it does once each year, an equinox occurs.<br />\n<br />\nBecause the First Point of Aries is the zero-point for calculating coordinates on the Celestial Sphere, its own coordinates are always fixed, regardless of its motion. They are, of course, zero hours Right Ascension and zero degrees Declination.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html<br />\n<br />\nKERALA SAGES FROM KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY GAVE THE COSMIC ALLEGORIES FOR THE BIBLE IN 325 AD AT THE FIRST COUNCIL OF NICEA TO THE ROMAN EMPEROR .<br />\n<br />\nJESUS CHRIST NEVER EXISTED<br />\n<br />\nJESUS WAS A CLEVER COMBINATION OF COSMIC ALLEGORY/ APPOLONIUS OF TYANA , A KERALA SAGE AND HIS SIDE KICK DAMISA ( WHO MARRIED MARY OF MAGDALENE \u2013A NAMBOODIRI WOMAN )</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; Sattva preserves and mediates .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">7000 year old Vedas say that the only constant in the cosmos is change, everything is in a state of flux, nothing is static-- everything is vibratory. This is what guarantees growth and evolution. It is a cosmic spiraling dance of separate opposing forces, which sustains this universe<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">One cannot exist without the other and they are dependant . And only Vishnu can have mortal avatars.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">As for the opposing forces TAMAS/ RAJAS ( Brahma/ Shiva ) it really does NOT matter as who is who, like in AC electricity-where you can plug into the socket both ways.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">These two opposing forces are natural and transform each other , in perfect harmony. Harmony can never be stagnant . Lessening of Tamas always results in increase of Rajas and vice versa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Balance can never be permanent\u2014 Tamas and Rajas continiously devour each other \u2013 and life flows on.
