font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He\nremarked, \u201cA King who administers justice in accordance with \u2018dharma\u2019,\nevidence, customs, and written law will be able to conquer whole world\u201d. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya&nbsp; hastened to add that the King was not the\nsole interpreter of dharma. In fact there was no specific institution vested\nwith the authority of interpreting dharma.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every individual was deemed\ncompetent to interpret it. &nbsp;This was an\nimportant factor in ensuring the non-religious character of the Vedic state.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya however &nbsp;did not view law to be an expression of the\nfree will of the people. Thus sovereignty \u2013 the authority to make laws, did not\nvest with citizens. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Laws were derived\nfrom four sources \u2013 dharma (scared law), vyavhara (evidence), charita (history\nand custom), and rajasasana (edicts of the King). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya &nbsp;prescribed that any matter of dispute shall be\njudged according to four bases of justice.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These in order of increasing\nimportance are:---</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2013 \u2018Dharma\u2019, which is\nbased on truth</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2013 \u2018Evidence\u2019, which is\nbased on witnesses</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2013 \u2018Custom\u2019, i.e.\ntradition accepted by the people</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2013 \u2018Royal Edicts\u2019, i.e.\nlaw as promulgated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kautilya, who framed an\nelaborate system of policing and laid down several grades of bureaucracy, could\nrightly be called the father of the modem concept of police. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dandaniti propounded by\nKautilya in Arthasastra was the science of dealing with crimes and punishments.\nLater Danda became the essence of the Government.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kautilya advises the\nKing to have his spies controlled by reliable and capable ministers. The\nArthasastra contains amazingly interesting accounts of the work of individual\nspies, whose names are given and whose subterfuges and disguises are described <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The policing system of\nKautilya was on two distinct lines; i.e. civilian departments entrusted with\npolice powers and a cadre of regular police officers. &nbsp;He had conferred police powers on almost all\nthe departments, which had public dealings.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra itself is\na well-constructed text, ideal as a handbook for the ruler of a well-governed\nkingdom. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All aspects of what we might\nthink of as policy, planning, infrastructure, strategy, security, war,\ntreaties, alliances, law and order, trade, taxation, revenue, property,\nfortifications, treasury, and defense are covered in a systematic fashion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AnvIkShikI trayI\nvArtAnAM yoga-kShema-sAdhano daNDaH | tasya nItir daNDa nItiH |\nalabdha-lAbhaarthA labdha-parirakShaNI rakShita vivardhanI vR^iddhasya tIrthe\npratipAdanI cha || 1.4.03<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The daNDa [is the\npower] by which the application and the growth of the systems of logical\nanalysis, the veda and business are upheld. Its management is known as\npolitical science. It is the means by which new acquisitions are made, profits\nare gained [in business], the acquisitions are kept secure, security and growth\n[are achieved] and the fruits of growth are re-distributed among the deserving.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nevertheless, with\nrespect to the actual application of daNDa, viShNugupta advocates what might be\ntermed the path of moderation:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201ctasmAl loka yAtrA\n.arthI nityam udyata-daNDaH syAt || na hy evaM vidhaM vasha^upanayanam asti\nbhUtAnAM yathA daNDaH|\u201d ity AchAryAH ||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWhoever is desirous of\nprogress of the world shall always do so with the upraised rod of chastisement.\nNever can there be a better instrument to bring beings [implying people and\nother animals] under control than the application of chastisement.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">na^iti kauTilyaH ||\ntIkShNa.daNDo hi bhUtAnAm udvejanIyo bhavati || mR^idu daNDaH paribhUyate ||\nyathA .arha daNDaH pUjyate || 1.4.05-10<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cNot so,\u201d says\nkauTilya; for whoever imposes severe chastisement becomes tyrannical to the\nbeings [a police state]; while he who is mild in chastisement is\ndespised/disrespected [a soft state]. But he who imposes punishment as deserved\nis respected [the ideal Hindu state].<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya is clear that\nlearning analytical devices is not for all and sundry, and outlines who can do\nso:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">shushrUShA shravaNa\ngrahaNa dhAraNa vij~nAna^Uhaapoha tattvaabhiniviShTa buddhiM vidyA vinayati\nna^itaram || 1.5.05<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The acquisition of\nknowledge can only culture those whose intellect is endowed with the abilities\nof discipline, learning from verbal instruction, grasping concepts, memory,\ndiscrimination, inference and applying falsification, but not others [those who\nlack these].<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">shrutAd hi\npraj~nA^upajAyate praj~nAyA yogo yogAd AtmavattA^iti vidyAnAM sAmarthyam ||\n1.5.16<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verily from hearing\n(i.e. gathering information) emerges knowledge; that knowledge allows its\napplication; from its application one becomes prudent. This is the power of\nknowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vidyA vinIto rAjA hi\nprajAnAM vinaye rataH | ananyAM pR^ithivIM bhu~Nkte sarva-bhUta-hite rataH ||\n1.5.16<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The king who is\neducated in the fields of knowledge, verily interested in administration of his\npeople, and inclined to benefi benefit all beings will enjoy the earth\nunopposed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">gAndharvaM nR^ittam\nAlekhyaM vAdyaM cha gaNitaM kalAH |<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">arthashAstraM\ndhanurvedaM yatnAd rakShen mahIpatiH || chANakya-rAjanIti 75<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Music, dance, painting,\ndiscourse, mathematics, technologies, economics and military science, a king\nshould painstakingly protect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Listen to Chanakya &nbsp;\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cIn the happiness of\nhis subjects lies the King\u2019s happiness; In their welfare his welfare.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He shall not consider\nas good only that which pleases him but, Treat as beneficial to him whatever\npleases his subjects\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Chanakya , 2350 years ago, cautioned the\nking against the undesirable consequences of unduly severe punishment. &nbsp; &nbsp;In all\nspheres of state-activity one finds that Chanakya avoids the extreme and adopts\nthe middle-of- the-road policy. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Masking\nArthashastra a manual for the king and his ministers/ administrators, Kautilya\nperceived their problems with such clarity of vision that his solutions became\na veritable storehouse of learning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Before 7000 BC, India ruled the whole planet.\nIndia only gave\u2014never took.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The greatest gift was the rule of DHARMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If men were angels, no government would be\nnecessary.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;\u2014James\nMadison<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the pre-Vedic period society governed\nthemselves by the laws of Dharma inherent in the Vedas.&nbsp; During these times Vedas were on oral route.\nAfter 330 centuries on oral route Vedas were penned down 70 centuries ago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In those days the punishment of a bad man\nrested on the wronged person.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This code of conduct, which governed the\naffairs of the people, came to be known as Dharma or law.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The following verse describes the importance\nof the Dharma (law):--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Those who destroy Dharma get destroyed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Dharma protects those who protect it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Therefore Dharma should not be destroyed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Dharma flowed from Vedas. Those days Vedas\nwere on oral route and no pretenders were allowed into the system.&nbsp;&nbsp; Like in modern days nobody expects a nurse\nor a sweeper of a surgery room to pretend they know brain surgery..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;In\ncourse of progress man felt that it was more convenient to live in society\nrather than in small groups. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the very early period of the Indian\ncivilization great importance was attached to Dharma. Everyone was acting\naccording to Dharma and there was no necessity of any authority to compel\nobedience to the law. The society was free from the evils arising from\nselfishness and exploitation by the individual.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Each member of the society scrupulously\nrespected the rights of his fellow members and infraction of such rights rarely\nor never took place.&nbsp; The following verse\nindicates the existence of such an ideal society.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There was neither kingdom nor the King; neither\npunishment nor the guilty to be punished. People were acting according to\nDharma; and thereby protecting one another.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A situation arose when some persons began to\nexploit and torment the weaker sections of society for their selfish ends.\nTyranny of the strong over the weak reigned unabated. This situation forced the\nlaw abiding people to search for a remedy. This resulted in the discovery of\nthe institution of King and establishment of his authority over the society,\nwhich came to be known as the State.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;In the\nRig-Veda the King is called Gopa janasya or protector of the people. This\nimplies that he was charged with the maintenance of law and order. According to\nthe Dharma sutras and the Arthashastra, it was the duty of the King to ensure\nthe security and welfare of his subjects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Each state was divided into provinces and the\nprovinces into divisions andndistricts. For each province, governors were\nappointed. District officers werenentrusted with the judicial and\nadministrative functions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">According to Chanakya\u2019s &nbsp;Arthashastra, the administration of towns was\nentrusted to the Nagarka. He had not only to look after the maintenance of law\nand order but had also to enforce various building and sanitary regulations and\nto prepare census of the citizens<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Apart from cities and towns, there were a\nlarge number of villages. In fact, the village was the basic unit of\ngovernment. Each village consisted of a village headman and Village Council or\nPanchayat. The office of the village headman was mostly hereditary. In villages\nhe represented the King\u2019s administration.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The most remarkable feature of the early\nVedic polity was the institution of popular assemblies, of which two, namely,\nthe Sabha and Samiti deserve special mention.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the later Vedic period, the\nSamiti disappeared as popular assembly while the Sabha became a narrow body\ncorresponding to the King\u2019s Privy Council.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">They introduced two new grades of military or\njudicial officers, Mahadandanayaks and Dandanayaks, to make the justice system\nmore effective.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The law was recognized as a mighty instrument\nnecessary for the protection of the individual\u2019s rights and liberties. Whenever\nthe right or liberty of an individual was encroached upon by another, the\ninjured individual could seek the protection of the law with the assistance of\nthe King, howsoever powerful the opponent might be.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The power of the King to\nenforce the law or to punish the wrong doer was recognized as the force\n(sanction) behind the law, which could compel implicit obedience to the law.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The laws of Manu (millenniums&nbsp; before Laws of Chanakya vide Arthashastra )\nis THE most authoritative work in ancient times -- adopted world wide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">According to Chanakya , an essential duty of\ngovernment is maintaining order . He defines this broadly to include both\nmaintenance of social order as well as order in the sense of preventing and\npunishing criminal activity.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Chanakya\nhas mentioned the law of procedures; the law of evidence in civil as well as\ncriminal cases; procedure of criminal investigation; and quantum and method of\npunishments for various types of offences. Prisons, lockups and welfare of\nprisoners are also the subject matters of the Arthashastra. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Chanakya had prescribed code of conduct for\nJudges and even for the mighty King.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\u201cNo,\u201d says Kautilya; for whoever imposes\nsevere punishment becomes repulsive to the people; while he who awards mild\npunishment becomes contemptible. But whoever imposes punishment as deserved\nbecomes respectable.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For punishment (danda) when awarded with due consideration,\nmakes the people devoted to righteousness and to works productive of wealth and\nenjoyment; while punishment, when ill-awarded under the influence of greed and\nanger or owing to ignorance, excites fury even among hermits and ascetics\ndwelling in forests, not to speak of householders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But when the law of punishment is kept in\nabeyance, it gives rise to such disorder as is implied in the proverb of fishes\n(matsyanyayamudbhavayati); for in the absence of a magistrate\n(dandadharabhave), the strong will swallow the weak; but under his protection,\nthe weak resist the strong. [Arthashastra I:4]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It was provided that in cases where no\nprinciple of law was found in the Shruti, Smritis &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">or custom, the King should decide according\nto his conscience.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">At this time kings word\nappropriate to natural justice and within the perimeter of context was the\nlaw.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">Unlike modern times where old\nmindless judgements are preserved and used out of context to subvert the law (\nand cheat a judge with no brains ) , in ancient times every case was seen with\na fresh pair of eyes totally based on context. Justice was not blind in ancient\nIndia.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The criminal justice system of ancient India\nwas so organized that every villager had easy and convenient access to a\njudicial forum. In Vedic society the village Samitis and Sabhas were two\nimportant instruments of Indian polity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Village Councils, similar to modern\nPanchayats, consisted of a board of five or more members to dispense justice to\nvillagers.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;Village headman had the authority to levy\nfines on offenders.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">There were several village committees,\nincluding a justice committee, appointed by people\u2019s vote.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">Village Council dealt with simple civil and\ncriminal cases.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Other criminal cases were presented before\nthe central court or the courts in towns and district headquarters presided\nover by the government officers under the Royal authority to administer\njustice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The first institution of state police may be\ntraced to &nbsp;a judgement&nbsp; recorded in Kautilya\u2019s Arthashastra. It\nmentions that the police during ancient India was divided in two wings, namely,\nthe regular police and the secret police. The regular police consisted of three\ntiers of officials: the Pradesta (rural) or the Nagaraka (urban) at the top,\nthe rural and urban Sthanikas in the middle and the rural and urban Gopas at\nthe bottom.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the course of his description of the Pradesta\u2019s duties.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Chanakya narrates how an inquest was held\nin case of sudden death. This involved a post-mortem examination of the body as\nwell as thorough police investigation. In&nbsp;\nChanakya\u2019s system the secret police is divided into two categories\nnamely, the peripatetic and the stationary.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The ancient Manu Smriti prescribed\ninstructions for the King to detect offences with the help of soldiers and\nspies. The Katyayana Smriti mentions of informant and investigating officer.\nThis suggests that an agency like modern police existed during that period to\nassist the King in administration of justice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It was provided that a jail should be\nconstructed in the capital providing separate accommodation for men and women\nand it should be guarded. It was also prescribed that the prisoners should be\nemployed in useful work. The policy of taking a sympathetic view, as regards\npersons found guilty of offences and punished with imprisonment imposed on\nthem, was also laid down in the ancient Indian law.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Dharmamahamatras were\ncharged with the duty of protecting prisoners from molestation and releasing\nthe deserving ones. The Arthashastra gives a detailed account of jail administration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Violation of criminal laws was considered an\noffence against the State. Any member of the public could bring the violation\nto the notice of the King and the King was under a duty to apprehend and punish\nthe offender. It was provided that the King should take cognizance on his own,\nwith or without any complaint by a private party, of criminal offences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The information or complaint about the\noffence committed by any individual could be made by any citizen and not\nnecessarily by the person injured or his relatives. The person, who on his own\naccord detected commission of offences and reported to the King, was known as\nstobhaka, i.e.informant. He was entitled to remuneration from the King for\ngiving first information.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A person who was appointed by the King to\ndetect commission of offences was called Suchaka, i.e. Investigation Officer.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The special responsibility of the King in the matter of controlling crimes,\ndetection of crimes and punishing the &nbsp;offenders\nwas stressed in the Manu Smriti that contained the following guidelines for the\nKing:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">(i) Persons who commit offences or who\nconspire to commit offences are generally found in assembly houses, hotels,\nbrothels, gambling houses, etc.;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">(ii) The King must post soldiers and spies\nfor patrolling such places and in order to keep away thieves and antisocial\nelements; and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">(iii) He should appoint reformed thieves who\nwere formerly associated with such doubtful elements and through them offenders\nmust be detected and punished.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The dandaniti, i.e. punishment policy, is one\nof the elaborately dwelt upon subjects in ancient India as it was intimately\nconnected with the administration of the State. Manu emphasized the importance\nand utility of punishment saying:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\u201cPunishment alone governs all created beings,\nit protects them and it watches over them while they are asleep.\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As per Manu there\nwere four kinds or methods of punishment during ancient India, namely, admonition,\ncensure, fine and corporal punishment. Corporal punishments included death\npenalty, &nbsp;branding on the head some mark\nindicating the offence committed, shaving the head of the offender and parading\nhim in public streets. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IN THE DAYS ON MANU THERE WERE NO SHUDRAS\nWHOM BRAHMINS TRAMPLED UPON. ALL THSE ARE LIES OF THE WHITE INVADER TO DIVIDE\nAND RULE .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THESE LIES WERE PROPAGATED\nBY ROTHSCHILDs PAYROLL&nbsp; AGENTS AND FAKE\nMUTTS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/07/untouchables-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\"><span style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/07/untouchables-capt-ajit-vadakayil.htm</span>l</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">MANU WAS A NOBLE MAHARISHI\u2014NOT A BIGOT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">People like BR Ambedkar and EVR Periyar (\nRothschild\u2019s agents ) bitched that dalits were NOT allowed to read the Vedas.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There was a good reason, when Vedas were on oral route and DHARMA was sourced\nfrom Vedas . You don\u2019t teach brain surgery to a hospital sweeper or tell the\ncook to navigate the ship in fog in dense traffic&nbsp; .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">People like Kancha Iliah SQUEAK who feel it must be done can offer his\nchildren to a sweeper turned brain surgeon\u2014GOOD LUCK !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">You find white tourists coming to India and\nwriting when they go home: \u201cHindus do NOT care for the beggar on the street \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hey mister tourist --&nbsp; DID YOU CARE ?&nbsp; YOU TOOK A PHOTO FOR YOUR OWN SELFISH\nREASONS, RIGHT?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This is like BR Ambedkar moaning to the white\ninvader \u2014the Brahmin did NOT drink from my cup .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">HULLLOOO&nbsp;\nAmbedkar paaji \u2014did you check out if the white man would drink from the\nbrahmin\u2019s cup ( leave alone your cup )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Thiru EVR Periyar , Mahatma Phule saab ,\nKancha Ilaiah SQUEAK etc do NOT know that in ancient times Brahmins lived by\nbegging ( except in Kerala where Namboodiris owned all the land ).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Every ancient Purana and Pnchatantra story\nstarted off with there was a POOR Brahmin living in a hut.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">No Hindu ever fights in the name of god.&nbsp; There are NO inquisitions where the priests\nrevel in torture and killing of Kaffirs by FATWA of Mullahs .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hindus do NOT rush out of temples on Friday\nnoon as a gang to lynch people of other religions . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hullo, Mr Prannoy JAMES Roy ( NDTV ) , with\nan Irish mother\u2014understand this well .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hinduism has never advocated conversion, all\nare aware of this truth. The exodus has already started. I predict in another\n10 years almost all Christians will cremate their bodies .&nbsp; People now ponder about the SOUL.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Muslims are stuck. In kerala Muslim women in\nburqa can be seen consulting astrologers . They are NOT shy . SANATANA means\n\" that which holds eternal Vedic knowledge\"-- encompassing everything\nfrom microcosm to macrocosm. DHARMA means \" righteousness\".&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Dharma leads to eternal bliss, both in this\nworld and the next. It is your sole and soul companion after death. The\nfundamentals of Dharma as per the Bhagwat Gita are-- respect, truth, grace,\nrestraint, love, non-violence, restraint, lack of jealousy and greed, knowledge\nof self and austerity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sanatana Dharma respects the planet along\nwith its flora and fauna. It is the only religion which advocates\nvegetarianism. Manu , the ancient law giver was a committed environmentalist.\nManu wrote that polluting the environment was a punishable offence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Manu was a noble Maharishi.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; His image has been tarnished by the white\ninvader so that he could WEDGE AWAY the unskilled varna, using FAKE mutts and\nagents like BR Ambedkar and EVR Periyar.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Manu\u2019s laws in Manava Dharma Shastra ,\nare in 100000 verses in 24 books and was propagated from Palestine to Urals to\nVietnam in 7000 BC by the great Indian Emperor Vikramaditya who ruled these\nlands. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These laws were given 5300 years before\nHammurabi who lifted wholesale from these laws, leaving aside kindness to the\nenvironment and social grace. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In Manu\u2019s laws a person could be\nex-communicated from society for mindless felling of tress or killing of\nanimals, the way the English speaking white man shot the buffalo and\nexterminated the Indian American , or how the Australian Aborigine race was\nexterminated.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In Manu\u2019s laws destruction of nature was the\ndestruction of the state. Yet we Indians get lectured by the West daily,\nnowadays , on antipollution and the need to be environment friendly.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The whole\nidea of Vaastu was to construct something without disturbing the flow of nature\nand interrupting natural flow of energy. It is about peaceful co-existence and\ncomfort. Hindu Vedas and mantras revere,&nbsp;\nnay , worship nature , and its flora and fauna. Many animals and birds\nwere vehicles of god. The deities of Hinduism permeate the world of nature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hindus are blamed by the white man for\nilltreating women .&nbsp;&nbsp; If so why do we\npray to goddesses ? No god is complete without his wife<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/manu-first-law-maker-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/manu-first-law-maker-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Chanakya\u2019s&nbsp;\nlays down that awarding of punishment must be regulated by a consideration\nof the motive and nature of the offence, time and place, strength, age,\nconduct, learning and monetary position of the offender, and by the fact, whether\nthe offence is repeated.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An old man over eighty, a boy below sixteen, women and\npersons suffering from diseases were to be given half the punishment; a child\nless than five committed no offence and was not to suffer any punishment.&nbsp; In certain cases, the court was empowered to\ngrant compensation to the aggrieved party in addition to the punishment given\nto the offender.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Manu prescribed that a Brahmana offender (\nproficient in Vedas by oral route ) was not to be sentenced to death or\ncorporal punishment for any offence; in such cases other punishments were\nsubstituted. However Chanakya was against exempting Brahmanas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Chanakya mentions that a Brahmana who aspires\nfor the Kingdom, &nbsp;or is guilty of\nsedition or instigates disaffection or rebellion against the King shall be\nsummarily drowned. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Chanakya a Kerala Namboodiri professor ,himself\ndefied a king and uprooted a mighty empire. Chanakya is indeed Bharatmata\u2019s No 1\nson<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/alexander-great-and-king-porus-hidden.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/alexander-great-and-king-porus-hidden.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Manu Smriti had a similar provision which\nprovides that higher the varna of the offender greater the punishment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It was prescribed that the examination of\nwitnesses should not be delayed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A serious defect, namely, miscarriage of\njustice, would result owing to delay in examination of witnesses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;Witnesses were under legal compulsion to give evidence\nbefore the court. Failure to appear before the court entailed heavy penalty.\nFailure to give evidence amounted to giving false evidence. Perjury, i.e. the\nact of giving false evidence, was considered a serious offence and punishment\nwas prescribed for it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The entire wealth of a person, who cited false witnesses\nout of greed, would be confiscated by the King, and in addition he would be\nexterned. The party whose witnesses deposed against him could examine further\nand better witnesses to prove his case as well as to prove that the witnesses\nexamined earlier were guilty of perjury.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THE WHOLE WORLDs POLICING AND JUDICIAL SYSTEM\nWAS SOURCED FROM INDIA.&nbsp; BEFORE 7000 BC\nINDIA RULED THE WHOLE PLANET<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Failure of duty towards society was taken\nvery seriously. Any person who fails to render assistance according to his\nability in the prevention of crime would be banished with his goods and\nchattel.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Any owner of a house failing to\nhelp another at the time of outbreak of fire was liable to be fined. Double punishment\nwas prescribed for those who failed to give assistance to one calling for help\nthough they happened to be on the spot or who ran away after being approached\nfor help.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Right of self-defence existed during ancient\nIndia. The law provided: \u201cA person can slay without hesitation an assassin who\napproaches him with murderous intent. By killing an assassin the slayer commits\nno offence. A person has a right to oppose and kill another not only in\nself-defence but also in defence of women and weak persons who are not in a\nposition to defend themselves against murderous or violent attack.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Even killing\na Brahmana in exercise of such a right is no offence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Offences and misconduct committed by police\nofficers, Jail Superintendent and other public servants were taken very\nseriously and severe punishments were prescribed. It was provided that the\njudges who passed unjust order, or took bribes, or betrayed the confidence\nreposed in them, should be banished<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">We see in Arthashastra that law was not\nviewed just as code of prohibition, nor was it limited to corrective justice of\nlaw courts. Its range was wider than morality itself and institutions were\ncreation of law while traditions and customs rested on its sanctions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">All ideas of society were moulded by it and\nlaw was blended with religion, with morality and with public opinion and by its\nsubtle operations subjected the society to its will. The role of law in the\nsociety was to bring a just order in society and the tremendous task was to be\nshouldered by the King along with his subordinates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Arthashastra outlines a system of civil,\ncriminal, and mercantile law (now known as business laws).&nbsp;&nbsp; For example the following were codified: a\nfoolproof procedure for interrogation,&nbsp;\nand trial, the rights of the accused, what constitutes permissible\nevidence, a procedure for autopsy in case of death in suspicious circumstances,\nwhat constitutes defamation and procedure for claiming damages, valid and\ninvalid contracts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"http://img1.blogblog.com/img/b36-rounded.png\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6906644608656144887\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_229M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/06471797010022507536\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 10:17 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_229MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nNamaste Captain ji,<br />\n<br />\nI have been reading your series on Sanatana Dharma and any praise I can give will only be like holding a candle to the Sun. Thank you for your time and enormous effort.<br />\n<br />\nCaptain ji, there is one thing I always wanted to ask a man of your stature, and that is HANUMAN. Sir, Hanuman ji is depicted as a monkey \"vanara\", but Valmiki Ramayan says that \"vanara\" is just a human race found in the forests in Bharat.<br />\n<br />\nThen, in the SOUTH, Hanuman ji is shown with wife \"SUVARCHALA\" and there is also Hanuman - Suvarchala KALYANAM in South.<br />\n<br />\nYou have already asserted multiple times that all DASAS are fake, so by that understanding, TULSIDAS and his interpretation of Ramayana , Ramcharitmanas and hence Hanuman will also be \"colored\".<br />\n<br />\nDEAR SIR, is you could PLEASE write a thorough post on Hanuman ji, I sincerely think it will surpass the views and comments of all your other posts combined; while enlightening us on the issues I have outlined above.<br />\n<br />\nSIR, it is with immense hope that I am writing to you.<br />\n<br />\nThank you,<br />\n<br />\nSincerely,<br />\n<br />\nAnand Niranjan</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_229BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc;
